It turns out that the executive chair, largest shareholder, and former CEO of Walgreens is Stefano Pessina. In 1977, Pessina took over a family pharmaceutical wholesaler, which he later named Alliance Sant√©. About thirty years later, Alliance Sant√© merged with Boots Group, creating Alliance Boots. Pessina took Alliance Boots private in 2007 with a $22B deal. In 2014, Walgreens bought Alliance Boots, creating the new entity we know today, Walgreens Boots Alliance.

As Walgreens‚Äôs executive chair and its largest shareholder, currently, at 17% of shares, Pessina is effectively a founder of the company. Not to mention, Pessina is married to Walgreens‚Äôs Chief Operating Officer, Ornella Barra. Interestingly, neither of their official biographies on the Walgreens website mentions this relationship.

Of course, now that we‚Äôve done the research, we wanted to uncover exactly how influential Stefano Pessina is on the company‚Äôs board. Diving into the Board Sabermetrics data, our team discovered that Pessina has 64% of the total influence at Walgreens, while CEO Rosalind Brewer has a measly 10% influence.
